++ Copy An Std Map


Method 1: Using a range-based for loop with square bracket operator

    _rawMaterial.clear();
    for (const auto& fraction : fractions) {
        _rawMaterial[fraction.first] = fraction.second;
    }

Method 2: Using the std::map::insert method

    _rawMaterial.clear();
    for (const auto& fraction : fractions) {
        _rawMaterial.insert(fraction);
    }

Method 3: Using the std::map::emplace method

    _rawMaterial.clear();
    for (const auto& fraction : fractions) {
        _rawMaterial.emplace(fraction.first, fraction.second);
    }


Method 4: Using the constructor with iterators

    _rawMaterial.clear();
    _rawMaterial.insert(fractions.begin(), fractions.end());

Method 5: Using the std::copy algorithm

    _rawMaterial.clear();
    std::copy(fractions.begin(), fractions.end(), std::inserter(_rawMaterial, _rawMaterial.end()));
